New Records: Zach Edey shattered rookie records, becoming the first rookie with a 20/10 game, shooting at least 90% from the floor.
Key Match Events: The Nets edged ahead in the clutch behind another Dennis Schroder masterclass.
The Grizzlies got 25 points and nine assists from Ja Morant on 10 of 22 shooting.
Post-Match Reflections: Zach Edey's performance can give the team some confidence as the Grizzlies look to bounce back and string a lengthy winning stretch together over the coming weeks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Edey was a force in the second half amid the Grizzlies' struggles, helping them keep it close.

The Grizzlies got a relatively quiet night from the rest of the roster and 3-point shooting struggles in the absence of Desmond Bane hindered Memphis' chances of avenging Wednesday's loss to Brooklyn.
Others: The Memphis Grizzlies lost 106-104 to the Brooklyn Nets.
The game was a rematch between the two teams, with Zach Edey and the Grizzlies playing the Brooklyn Nets on Monday at home.
